common_issues.title: Pieces OS Copilot Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to the Pieces Copilot service, particularly within remote environments like WSL2 and Docker containers.  This seems to stem from network configuration issues, including default port changes and loopback interface restrictions.  Potential solutions involve adjusting WSL2 network settings, ensuring proper port access, and upgrading to the latest Pieces for VSCode extension (v2.0.2 or higher).

related_issues.title: VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
related_issues.text:
VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When Pieces OS is installed via snap in WSL2 for windows and VSCode is also installed through snap in WSL2, there is an issue detecting Pieces OS location and setting the proper API url.


Setting a custom url to the linux port 'http://localhost:5323' and following the WSL steps listed here: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance allows for communication between the VSCode extension and Pieces OS itself.

However, when VSCode attempts to request the Pieces Copilot -- The applet is launched on a port, the port is returned to the extension, but the Copilot fails to render in VSCode.

Until the root cause is detected and resolved, the recommended workaround is to install Pieces OS via Pieces Suite and run VSCode outside of WSL2 if at all possible.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* The issue involves connection problems with the Copilot extension in Pieces OS through WSL2.
* The root cause might be related to WSL2 network issues.
* Enabling Systemd and dns-tunnel in WSL configurations was suggested as a solution.
* The issue is not confirmed to be solely WSL2 related, as the Pieces extension can connect to the healthcheck API.

**Problems Identified:**

* Copilot extension cannot connect to the dynamically hosted port.
* Uncertainty whether the issue is solely related to WSL2.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Enabling Systemd and dns-tunnel in WSL configurations.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The proposed solutions haven't been implemented yet.
* Further investigation is needed to determine the root cause and implement effective solutions.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: **Key points raised:** * User (@malanciault) experiencing connection issues with Pieces OS in VSCode DevContainer. * The default port in Pieces OS changed from 1000 to 39300 (or higher). * The issue only occurs when using a remote project in DevContainer. **Problems identified:** * The default listening interface of Pieces Server is loopback, preventing connection from DevContainer. * `host.docker.internal` resolution does not work with Webview tool windows. **Solutions proposed/implemented:** * Patch to allow listening on all interfaces (implemented in v2.0.1 of Pieces VSCode extension). * DNS configuration workaround (rejected by user). **Current status/outcome:** * The issue has been resolved in Pieces for VSCode extension version 2.0.2. * The user will upgrade to the new version and work with Pieces support if the issue persists.

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Service Inaccessible
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Copilot being unresponsive or inaccessible, encountering errors like 'Something went wrong with processing' or connection issues. This affects both desktop and VS Code extensions across Windows and macOS. Proposed solutions include upgrading to the latest Pieces OS version, temporarily using the GPT4o model, removing OpenAI API keys, and waiting for official bug fixes.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User @laborer123 reported the issue with "me too".
* User @danielmartinezsarta was able to resolve the issue by removing the OpenAI API key, but questioned how to register their API key.

**Problems identified:**

* Users were experiencing issues with Claude and Gemini models.
* OpenAI API keys were potentially causing failures.
* The reason behind the failures with OpenAI API keys is unclear.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* User @mark-at-pieces suggested switching to the GPT4o model as a temporary workaround.
* Upgrading to version 11.0.3 and ensuring Pieces login were advised.
* Keeping the OpenAI API key out of the product was proposed for further investigation.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue with OpenAI API keys is still under investigation. 
* Users can use the GPT4o model as a temporary solution.
* Users are advised to keep their OpenAI API keys out of the product for now.

**Further Information:**

* The solution proposed by user @mark-at-pieces regarding GPT4o appears to be the most current and helpful advice for users experiencing issues.
* User @danielmartinezsarta's question about API key registration remains unanswered based on the provided conversation.

* The next steps were clearly communicated to the user.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Performance Issues and Errors
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage, connection errors, and plugin unresponsiveness. Proposed solutions include restarting PiecesOS, optimizing memory, and checking internet connection. The Pieces team is actively investigating and resolving these issues.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## PiecesOS High Memory Usage Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* PiecesOS is experiencing high memory usage, even when not actively being used.
* Some users report usage exceeding 5GB of RAM.
* The issue seems particularly prevalent on Linux and macOS.
* Users are concerned about the impact on their system performance.

**Problems Identified:**

* **Memory Leak:** There appears to be a memory leak in PiecesOS, causing it to consume more RAM over time.
* **High Base Usage:** Even with no active usage, PiecesOS consumes a significant amount of RAM due to its underlying technologies like ML models and the Workstream Pattern Engine.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Optimize Memory Feature:** A feature to unload unused ML models and free up RAM has been implemented.
* **Performance Improvements:** The Pieces team is actively working on improving the overall performance and memory efficiency of PiecesOS.
* **Live Context Toggle:** Turning off the Live Context feature can reduce RAM usage.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still ongoing, with some users reporting persistent high resource usage.
* The Pieces team is actively addressing the problem and working towards a resolution.
* Users are encouraged to report their experiences and help the team diagnose the issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems to be more prevalent on certain operating systems and configurations.
* Users can try the Optimize Memory feature and turning off Live Context to mitigate the impact.
* The Pieces team is committed to resolving the issue and improving the overall performance of PiecesOS.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @bschwenk reported two issues:
    * Context issue with Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o model.
    * Line numbers wrapping in response.
* @mark-at-pieces assigned the issue and identified the context issue as the system returning a response but not including the provided file.
* @sam-at-pieces identified a potential fix for the context issue and provided a link to the proposed solution.
* @mark-at-pieces confirmed that the context issue is resolved and will be released in version 11.0.4. 

**Problems Identified:**

* Files not being included in context when using Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o model.
* Line numbers wrapping in response.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A fix for the context issue has been implemented and will be released in version 11.0.4.
* Investigation into the line number wrapping issue is ongoing.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The context issue has been resolved and will be released in the next version.
* The line number wrapping issue is still under investigation.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Search and Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS search not returning results, experiencing connectivity problems, and plugin unresponsiveness. Proposed solutions include upgrading search algorithms, investigating log files for specific errors, and improving context handling in code analysis.

related_issues.title: Neural Code Search returns no results
related_issues.text:
Neural Code Search returns no results
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have four materials entered since a few days ago and NCS type search never returns anything.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cea82b95-b382-45f3-8777-227d3abd2269)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/175e6117-9ef6-49c0-94f2-26812b788080)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@hovek) reported issues with the search functionality in Pieces.
* Support bot acknowledged the issue and provided resources.
* Mark from Pieces team confirmed the need for search upgrade.

**Problems Identified:**

* Lack of clarity in different search methods (NCS, FTS, Blended).
* Confusion about what each method searches (content, metadata, etc.).
* Difficulty finding specific code snippets using expected methods.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* NCS search for semantic meaning of code.
* FTS search for exact character matches.
* Blended search for content and metadata with fuzzy matching.
* Major search upgrade planned for the end of the quarter.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Solutions proposed with explanations on when to use each method.
* Search upgrade in progress, expected completion by end of Q1 2025.
* User acknowledged and thanked for reporting the issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* User provided feedback on desired search functionality.
* Pieces team recognized the need for improvement and is actively working on it.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @bschwenk reported two issues:
    * Context issue with Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o model.
    * Line numbers wrapping in response.
* @mark-at-pieces assigned the issue and identified the context issue as the system returning a response but not including the provided file.
* @sam-at-pieces identified a potential fix for the context issue and provided a link to the proposed solution.
* @mark-at-pieces confirmed that the context issue is resolved and will be released in version 11.0.4. 

**Problems Identified:**

* Line numbers wrapping in response.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

related_issues.title: Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
related_issues.text:
Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

version: 8.0

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Issue:**
I am encountering difficulties with installing and launching the Pieces Windows desktop version. After a successful installation, the software fails to open properly. Despite confirming its presence in the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

- Download and install the Pieces Windows desktop version.
- Attempt to launch the software.
- Observe that the program does not open on the screen.
- Check the task manager to confirm the software is running in the background.

**Expected Behavior:**
Upon installation, the Pieces Windows desktop version should launch and display its interface on the screen, allowing users to interact with it

**Actual Behavior:**
After installation, the software does not open as expected. Despite running in the background according to the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**System Information:**

- Windows version: 22H2 (OS Build 19045)

**Additional Notes:**
I have attempted to troubleshoot this issue without success. Any assistance or insights into resolving this matter would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* Users are experiencing issues launching Pieces OS from both the Pieces suite and the start menu.
* The Pieces OS system tray icon displays a green circle and "Connecting Pieces Apps" message.
* Users are unable to use Pieces features in their browser, receiving a "Failed to connect to Pieces OS!" error message.
* The issue affects both Windows and MacOS users.

**Problems identified:**

* The underlying cause of the launch issue is unclear.
* The Pieces OS system tray icon seems to indicate a connection issue.
* The browser extension is unable to connect to Pieces OS, preventing users from accessing features.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Updating Microsoft's App Installer is recommended for Windows users.
* Users are advised to ensure Pieces app and browser extension are up-to-date.
* Troubleshooting steps for specific error messages have not been provided.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved for multiple users.
* The cause of the problem and potential solutions require further investigation.

recommendations: **Prioritize Copilot Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and resolve the recurring issues related to Pieces Copilot, such as connection problems, inaccessibility, and errors.  This is the most frequent and impactful problem category.

**Improve Remote Environment Support:** Focus on enhancing Pieces Copilot's compatibility with remote development environments like WSL2 and Docker containers. Address network configuration challenges and ensure seamless functionality in these environments.

**Optimize PiecesOS Performance:** Investigate and address the reported performance issues with PiecesOS, including high RAM/CPU usage, connection errors, and plugin unresponsiveness. Optimize memory management and improve overall stability.

**Enhance Search Functionality:** Improve the search functionality within Pieces OS by upgrading search algorithms, enhancing context handling in code analysis, and ensuring consistent and accurate results.

**Address Desktop App Launch Issues:** Investigate and resolve the reported issues with the Pieces desktop app failing to launch or connect, particularly on macOS and Windows. Ensure smooth and reliable app initialization and connection to Pieces OS.

**Review and Update Documentation:** Update support documentation and FAQs to address the common issues with detailed troubleshooting steps, especially for remote environment configurations, Copilot connection problems, and performance optimization.

**Gather More Detailed User Feedback:** Implement mechanisms to collect more comprehensive user feedback on specific error messages, system configurations, and steps to reproduce issues. This will aid in faster and more effective troubleshooting.

**Proactive Communication:**  Keep users informed about ongoing issues, planned fixes, and estimated resolution timelines.  Transparency builds trust and manages expectations during service disruptions.

**Prioritize Issues Based on Activity:** Use the 'activity level' metric to prioritize issues that are generating the most user engagement and discussion.  This helps focus on problems with the broadest impact.

**Analyze Issue Trends:** Regularly analyze support tickets for emerging trends and patterns. This helps identify potential systemic issues or areas where product improvements can reduce support volume over time.]}
